model:
&types;
Registration
Display name used for local user interface as well as SIP signaling.
User Address
user (e.g. '1002'), the implied domain will be the registration server.
Text label to appear on the display adjacent to the associated line key. If omitted, the label will be derived from the user part of 'Registration Server'
private private OR shared. If set to private, use standard call signaling. If set to shared, augment call signaling with call state subscriptions and notifications and use access control for outgoing calls.
This field must match the Address value of the other registration which makes up the bridged line.
User ID to be used for authentication challenges for this registration. If non-empty, will override the 'Reg User' parameter entered into the Authentication submenu off of the Settings menu on the phone.
Password to be used for authentication challenges for this registration. If non-empty, will override the 'Reg Password' parameter entered into the Authentication submenu off of the Settings menu on the phone.
2 The ring type for each registration can be configured. Note: ring type number 1 is silent ring.
The number of line keys on the phone to be associated with registration. Only set to maximum number of lines. If not specified, value is 1
The number of calls or conferences which may be active or on hold per line key for a specific registration on the phone.
Microsoft 2005 LCS server
Outbound Proxy
Only required if both the following conditions are true. First, you want to direct all outgoing SIP traffic to a server other than the address you specified for the registration server. Second, you want the outbound proxy only for this line. All other lines will continue to send traffic to the registrar. NOTE: If you want to set the outbound proxy for all lines, goto to the phone settings for "Sip Server"
Outbound Proxy Port
Outbound Proxy Transport
DNSnaptr
Registration server
Primary registration server
server.1.address
Primary Registration Server. IP address or host name of a SIP server that accepts registrations.
server.1.port
0, empty, 1 to 65535
server.1.transport
DNSnaptr DNSnaptr, TCPpreferred or UDPonly. If empty or DNSnaptr and if Address is a hostname and Port is 0 or empty, do NAPTR then SRV look-ups to try to discover the transport, ports and servers, as per RFC 3263. If Address is an IP address, or a port is given, then UDP is used. If set to TCPpreferred: TCP is the preferred transport, UDP is used if TCP fails. If set to UDPonly: Only UDP will be used.
server.1.expires
positive integer
Re-registration interval server.1.expires.overlap
60 positive integer between 5 and 65535.
server.1.register
0, 1 enable registration
server.1.retryTimeOut
server.1.retryMaxCount
server.1.expires.lineSeize
Secondary Registration Server
server.2.address
Secondary Registration Server. IP address or host name of a SIP server that accepts registrations.
server.2.port
0, empty, 1 to 65535
server.2.transport
DNSnaptr DNSnaptr, TCPpreferred or UDPonly. If empty or DNSnaptr and if Address is a hostname and Port is 0 or empty, do NAPTR then SRV look-ups to try to discover the transport, ports and servers, as per RFC 3263. If Address is an IP address, or a port is given, then UDP is used. If set to TCPpreferred: TCP is the preferred transport, UDP is used if TCP fails. If set to UDPonly: Only UDP will be used.
server.2.expires
Re-registration interval server.2.expires.overlap
60 positive integer between 5 and 65535.
server.2.register
0, 1 enable registration
server.2.retryTimeOut
empty or non-negative integer
server.2.retryMaxCount
empty or non-negative integer
server.2.expires.lineSeize
positive integer
Call Handling
Auto Off Hook/Ring Down Phone will automatically dial this contact immediately upon lifting handset (or similiar operation with headset). This is useful for lobby phones or as a integration technique when interfacing with legacy PBXes that manage call state.
0 If set to 1, a call will be automatically placed to the contact specified upon going off hook on this registration.
ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)
Missed Calls
0 If set to 0, all missed-call events will increment the counter If set to 1, only missed-call events sent by the server will increment the counter.
Diversion SoundPoint(R) IP contains a flexible call forward/diversion feature for this line. In all cases, a call will only be diverted if a non-empty contact has been configured.
The forward-to contact used for all automatic call diversion features unless overridden by a specific contact of a per-call diversion feature.
1 If set to 1, calls may be diverted using the Auto Divert feature of the directory. This is a global flag.
1 If set to 1, all diversion features on this line will be disabled if the line is configured as shared.
Forwarding
0 If set to 1, the user will be able to enable universal call forwarding via the soft key menu.
On Busy
1 If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on busy to the contact specified below.
Forward-to contact for calls forwarded due to busy status, if empty, Contact will be used. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)
On No Answer
1 If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on no answer to the contact specified.
60 Time in seconds to allow altering before initiating the diversion.
Forward-to contact used for calls forwarded due to no answer, if empty, Contact will be used. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)
On Do Not Disturb
0 If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on DND to the contact specified below.
Forward-to contact used for calls forwarded due to DND status, if empty Contact will be used. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)
Dial Plan
0 When present, and if no digitmap setting are set, this attribute overrides the global dial plan in Dial Plan settings.
1 When present, and if no digitmap setting are set, this attribute overrides the global dial plan in Dial Plan settings.
Digit Map
When present, this attribute overrides the global dial plan defined Phone's Dial Plan settings
Time out
When present, this attribute overrides the global dial plan defined Phone's Dial Plan settings
Emergency Gateway
IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that will be used for routing calls.
Emergency Numbers
This represents the URLs that should be watched for emergency routing. When one of these defined URL is detected as being dialed by the user, the call will be automatically directed to the defined emergency server.
Messaging SoundPoint(R) IP supports message-waiting indication on a per-registration basis.
If non-empty, the phone will send a SUBSCRIBE request to this contact after boot-up. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)
contact
registration
disabled
disabled contact, registration or disabled, If set to 'contact', a call will be placed to the contact specified in the callback attribute when the user invokes message retrieval. If set to 'registration', a call will be placed using this registration to the contact registered (the phone will call itself). If set to 'disabled', message retrieval is disabled.
Contact to call when retrieving messages for this registration.
